education.degree: Full Stack (MERN) Web & Mobile Development - Graduate with Honors
education.description: Completed all coursework and multiple personal portfolio projects to earn Honors distinction.
Degree in Public Relations. Completed Bachelor's Degree in three years.

work.title: IT Project Manager
work.description: Designed and built secure, scalable, lightweight services, features, and applications for the web using C# and SQL - including some light front-end work. Worked with business and development team to ideate, iterate, and prototype new capabilities for system platform. Orchestrated key architectural decisions on CRM and eCommerce integration solution that focused on customer-centric experience. Researched, coordinated, and managed database migration from a proprietary system to HubSpot CRM, Shopify platform, coupled with proprietary business workflow component for seamless data sync. Formulated new system testing, implementation, and training plans. Presented weekly cross-team project updates to stakeholders and led collaboration between teams to keep project on target and on budget. Promoted from Assistant Sales Manager, executing 50% YOY growth in core investment programs, critical to the companyâ€™s bear market profitability. Supervised, trained, and motivated Sales Representatives for success within the company and beyond. Achieved top sales figures since 2014, averaging over $350,000 gross profit per year while working 100% remote.

testimonials.text: Ryan stood out to me as a very sharp student from very early on in the course. He has shown multiple great engineering qualities. He is one of the few who always engage and participate during class discussion and always eager to learn. I highly recommend him for any junior Web Development position or junior Software Engineer position. I believe that he would be a great asset to any company.

I had an opportunity to teach Ryan bootstrap, through his Nucamp journey, and coach him through his career. He is a fast learner and understands technology and concepts quickly.He helped struggling students with troubleshooting and debugging code when he was done with his assignments. He is a team player, critical thinker and ambitious. He would be a great asset to any company.

Ryan was definitely a 'go-to person' for me. When something important needed done he was definitely someone I could count on. He cares about his work, supports the people he works with, and delivers to his clients. I am really excited about his new venture, and look forward to hearing of his success. If I could work with him again, I would in a second.
